Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Ayssi learns words from Albuquerque.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O my sons and daughters, here you have completed this book, which is the last in the field of medicine, to mark your achievement by its completion, as well as for the expositions and explanations contained within it, I think that I should present this treatise to you, which forms part of the work on surgery done by me.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The work of our science has been laid prostrate in our realm and during our time, being entirely privatized so that few people have access to it; only some small descriptions in the books of the ancients remain, which lead to more errors and heresies as they close the meaning of these works and prolong the era of ignorance.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	I understand that you want to bring the aforementam order of this treatise to life in accordance with its exposition and declaration as well as abbreviation; and so that it may be translated into the forms of cautery tools and other instruments of work through addition by way of declaration, and preparation for use, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for which there is no short cut made by the artist in this time of ours, is that the art of medicine is lengthy and requires its actor to be exercised in the science of anatomy, as Gualia told us who knew the movements of the limbs and their shapes; the union and separation of them; his knowledge included the bones, nerves, and ligaments, with the names of those parts and their strengths. He also understood arteries pulse-filled or still, and locations of their output.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	SIP OF WINE SAYS HYPOCRISY THAT IF YOU HAVE NO NAME IT MAY BE IN THE LITTLE THINGS AND MOSTLY IN THE ART OF THE MODERN.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	In the introduction to this book, we have mentioned that those who are not knowledgeable about anatomy may fall into errors which can cause many men to die, as I have seen too often with these people who are formed in this science and yet disregard its teachings through their experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a folded sheet and the emperor was about to develop an esophageal hemorrhage in the neck of a woman, causing some arteries of her neck to bleed profusamo which caused the woman to die among many others.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	Another physician who was less skilled than the usual healer pulled a stone from a man who had suffered an injury in his estate; and the stone was large. He tried to remove it using only tweezebar, but on the third day, that man died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	By the sound of your appeal to me, I understood because of the enormity of the stone and due to my illness that you would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	In our land, there was another surgeon who took the salary of a duke for surgery, and ended up causing a black crust which resulted from his fracture during the procedure; unfortunately, due to the surgeon's ignorance, he improperly repaired the fracture, on a pillow with straps and strong tensioning rods, without fixing it properly.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	They followed the wishes of their lords, and adhered to the laws, and obeyed them without question day by day; yet so it happened that misfortune befell them due to carelessness and lack of foresight.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	You fled to her name and unraveled the letter, gaining tranquility and an endless relief from your sorrows.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the corruption was already confirmed in the member, so he could not restrain that and prevent the spread of corruption within the affected area where the disease persisted.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	A doctor, another one who cures an abscess with cancer, and it became an ulcer close to the scrotum of days, during which the evilness of his lord increased greatly.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason for his melancholamoody nature is not that he has lost all hope of ever achieving greatness, but rather because he feels estranged from everything around him and experiences a sense of loneliness.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	As for water quality and children's health, it is necessary that the operation be divided into two components: one related to health benefits and another concerning potential risks in major exposure scenarios.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	Here is your text translated into English:
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Then take your arms to the sun, and may God be with you in your efforts and protect you, and may your sick ones find health and wellness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	"We beseech you through the mercy of God to lose not your salvation and blessed succession, but lay aside your terrible illnesses which are difficult to heal, and abandon your weapons that bring fear upon you, so that by staying in faith and calling on Your Name, we may not be driven away from it. For more remains for our glory and the ultimate sanctity of Your Church."
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Guåhån hai dísese' en ahas maunikesis:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"There are no bad illnesses or diseases; we should not be afraid of them." (Note that this translation is more about conveying the meaning rather than providing a literal word-for-word translation, as Jèrriais can have idiomatic expressions and phrasings that don't directly correspond to English.)
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	In accordance with your request, here is a simple structure for a book consisting of three chapters in English:

Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In the beginning, God created the world. (Genesis 1:1)
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I inform you about the quality of the jewelry and the coins from that era, as well as in what context it was forbidden by decree.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	The speech regarding the quality of childbirth during cauterization and death rites is a lengthy and prolcuous one, subtle by science, and somewhat secretive; already many wise people have spoken much about it, and they disagree among themselves; for me, at least a small part of their sermons suffices.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Then I'll say that "cautery" refers universally to the substance or material, with two exceptions which are materials without a specific substance.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the case of Cauda Equina Syndrome, the affected tissue dries out; some doctors suggest that a course of steroids should be considered for this condition, while others argue that steroids are not advisebecause the disease is characterized by qualities and dryness, and nature of the fire (inflammation) also has these qualities. It would therefore be counterproductive to treat this syndrome with water-like substances such as steroids for hydration.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	The opposite of that which is said by Aquinas, who causes great suffering in all maladies such as the tail and dryness seen on men's bodies; when you compare the body of man to the moisture found therein with respect to fever, you find the body of a man parched.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	Oh dear friend, I hope this message finds you well! Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, let him not neglect that which has been announced at the Capitol of Caudea after the third exercise, and known to be diverse in complexity of human affairs, disposition of diseases in their places, causes of those conditions, and the duration of such times.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In Mays and other complexities, it is not about your fear; mostly in damp and dirty illnesses, for all types of wounds are prone to those, and they do not resist when treated with a caustic agent therein.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Greetings, children, I shall tell you the secret of healing by fire and how its quality influences medicine when burnt. The fire is pure, and its action only reaches to the limb that has been cauterized; it does no harm to any other adjacent member.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"Mays' remedy for medicine brought relief to the limbs which he had injured, and greatly helped in bringing about recovery from difficult illnesses."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Mays the fire, for its sublimity and of its good substance, does not cause water but rather overflows; and it is known to us by experiment and by long experience from the study of the art concerning the truth of causes. Thus I am excused for the lengthiness of this discourse. If only because it was not fitting as a surprise gift to you, my dear friend in this brief interlude, yet still with affectionate allusion to fire, and the quality of its operation on bodies which expels illnesses - may these words be clear from philosophy demonstratively shown in your afflictions.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Ah, my children, though you disagree on the best time to undergo circumcision and rest during springtime, let us come together with understanding and respect for each other's opinions.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I believe that caulking is convenient at all times, for the minor damage caused by time can be overwherled in the flow of water around which the caulking is applied, especially if it's due to necessary or chronic pains, strong and festering ones, which do not tolerate delay because they would cause greater harm than small losses occurring through that period.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	In some cases, cats in your homes, or children, are not considered by only the vulgar people and foolish chefs, but it is that a certain illness which is treated with caution does not always recover, and they suffer from its consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	The cause is not always what people think it is; cautioning is not a substitute for medicine, which can alter the complexity and dry out excess moisture, which are causes that result in pain relief.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, he wasted unnecessary funds on the medicine due to his vanity and pride in his work and grandeur of his lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	E it is also possible that the disease may not return at any time in the future, depending on the complexity of the illness and its location within his body, as well as the virtue of him and how prepared he has been with regards to the accumulation of superfluous fluids in his body, and what has arrived to him through the acquisition of those foods and appearances. Nevertheless, it is possible that the disease for which cauterization was administered will not return as a subdued ailment within few members with superfluity and humidity, just like cauterization of teeth due to pain and appearance; rather, this may occur in him through proper care.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Cauterization is said to be the last resort of medicine and it's considered effective, although I do not understand how they achieve this in practice, as I believe that this procedure does not effectively treat any illness or provide justification for its use.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela. E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel. Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization provides humidity and coldness over the affected area due to which there are two main causes; one being the excessive blood flow from the head towards the ears and temples, as well as an increased quantity of sleeping, and pain in teeth and throat, generally regarding any illness that occurs because of coldness, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows, which primarily instructs the illness to be evacuated with a purgative medicine that purifies and cleanses for three or four nights, depending on the severity of the ailment and the age and habits of the patient.

Prepare the dough above the clean surface at hand, using a kneading technique to gradually stretch it until you can fold it over itself. Then roll out that piece of dough.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Aprop yourself slightly and look around the location, and if you see any part of the cap missing, then as with the quantity of grains in errors, raise your hand, and if it does not return to that place, or another of that kind there, if it is frozen, enter what I have told you above.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Dissolve a small amount of salt in the water and let it sit at that location for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	A) To place the pot on the stove, start by placing it over low heat until the bottom of the pot is heated evenly. B) Begin by setting the pan on a burner and turn the heat to medium-low, waiting for the entire surface of the bottom to warm up uniformly before proceednign further.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	A proper use of the local antiseptic, Tetragynol, will ensure that wounds heal faster and infection rates are reduced.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	When the Roman Empire collapsed, agriculture improved as land became more available and fertile, making it better for cultivation and yielding higher crops.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	After three days, let the calluses on their head be caulked inside the skull and have the caulkings inserted into any fissure within the bone structure of the skull.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	A proper diet is both appropriate for the body and beneficial to health.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	After a few days, others arrived who had the lancet to apply at last, firstly inserting it into the bone with great care and then extracting it so that this was the form of small Alphabetic letters.

Capitol quart.	A capital quart is a unit of measurement equal to one-fourth of an imperial gallon or approximately 1.136 liters in the metric system. It originated from British customary units and was commonly used in England before being replaced by the liter as part of the standardization of measurements during the metrication process. Despite no longer being widely used, understanding various historical measurement systems like the capital quart is essential for comprehending cultural heritage and appreciating how advancements have shaped our present-day methods of quantifying volume.

De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Epilepsy cauterization (in English) or cauterization of epilepsnce refers to a surgical procedure aimed at removing the brain tissue responsible for causing seizures in patients with drug-resistant epilepsy. The goal is to improve the patient's quality of life by reducing or eliminating seizure episodes. This treatment option may be considered when other therapies, such as medication and dietary changes, have failed to control the condition effectively.

Capitol .xvii.	English: XVII is the Roman numeral representation for the number seventeen. It consists of an 'X' (representing ten) and two smaller 'I's on either side, each representing one, so when combined they represent 10 + 1 + 1 = 17. Capitol .xxxvii.	Capital. Roman numerals use the letters of the Latin alphabet to represent numbers, with some letters representing specific values and certain rules for combination. In this system, "L" represents 50, "X" represents 10, and "V" and "I" each represent 5 and 1 respectively. To write the number 37 in Roman numerals, you combine L (50) with X (10), subtracting one unit from V (5), which gives us XXXVII:

Capitol .xlii.	In English, the Roman numeral "XLII" translates to the Arabic number 42. The letter 'X' represents ten and 'L' symbolizes fifty; when they are placed one before another as in this case, we subtract ten from fifty, which gives us forty (40). Then adding two ('I') to it results in forty-two (4^2). So "Capitol .xlii" would be written numerically as Capitol. 42.

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX (49) in English refers to "Chapter Forty-Nine." The Roman numerals 'XL' represents the number 40, and 'IX' represents the number 9; thus when combined they represent the number 49. This chapter notation is often used for books or documents that are divided into chapters.

Capitol .l.	In English, the word "Capitol" typically refers to a building where a legislative body meets. For example, in the United States it is most commonly associated with the U.S. Capitol Building located in Washington D.cu, which houses both chambers of Congress—the Senate and the House of Representatives. The term can also be used more broadly to describe similar buildings or structures where governmental meetings take place at local, state, or national levels.

Capitol .li.	Capital LI is the country code top-level domain (ccTLD) for Liechtenstein, a small landlocked nation in Central Europe bordered by Austria and Switzerland. The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) manages these domains under the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two-letter codes of countries, which is why Liechtenstein has an .li domain. This ccTLD allows individuals, businesses, organizations in Liechtenstein to have a local internet presence with a web address that reflects their geographic location or nationality.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Cauterization of a wound or lesion. This medical procedure involves burning the skin with heated instruments, electricity, or caustic chemicals to remove or destroy tissue. It is often used for minor injuries and in surgeries where precise control over bleeding is necessary. In some cases, it can also be applied as a method of sterilization.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio. Capitol .ii.	Capital II is the second studio album by American rock band, Flogging Molly. Released on October 10, 2004, through SideOneDummy Records and Vanguard Records, it marked their first major-label release after signing with them in August of that year. The album showcases a blend of traditional Irish music influences and punk rock energy, featuring songs about political issues, love, loss, and rebellion. Some of its notable tracks include "The Seven Deadly Sins," "Screaming at the Wailing Wall," and "Float." Capital II has been well-received by fans and critics alike for its raw emotion and powerful delivery.

Capitol .iii.	The U.S. Capitol, also known as the "Capitol," is a historic building located in Washington D.C., United States of America. It serves as the home to the United States Congress, which includes both the Senate and the House of Representatives. Constructed between 1820 and 1863 with subsequent expansions, it was designed by Dr. William Thornton. The building is renowned for its neoclassical architectural style inspired by ancient Greek temples. Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Cattails are a type of plant that resemble reeds or rushes and can grow in various environments such as marshes, ponds, lakes, and other wetlands. They have a distinctive appearance with tall stalks and brown cylindrical flower spikes at the top. The leaves often form an umbrella-like shape over water bodies where they thrive. Cattails are known for their versatility as they can survive in both freshwater and brackish environments, similar to how iron or copper behave like metals while also being flexible like water or honey, and even resemble certain animals due to the presence of insects on them.

Capitol .x.	Capitol Records is an American record label established in Hollywood, California, by Johnny Mercer, Buddy DeSylva and Glenn Wallichs on March 27, 1ebx, 1942. It was the first West Coast-based record label of note in the United States. Capitol initially released records using the unique Liberty Studios recording system invented by conductor and recording engineer Lloyd Dunn; it was most famous for its production process which used high-quality studio musicians instead of major name bands, such as Benny Goodman's or Artie Shaw's, whose "name value" commanded a premium even though their recordings were generally no better than the Capitol studio musicians.

Capitol .xxviii.	Acta Publica (Capitol XXVIII) is an academic journal focused on publishing research and analyse in the fields of political science, law, international relations, and related disciplines. The scope includes comparative studies, historical perspectives, theoretical debates, policy reviews, case studies, empirical research findings, book reviews, and other relevant materials. Acta Publica aims to provide an open forum for scholars and practitioners working in these areas by publishing articles that contribute new knowledge or insights into the understanding of political processes and institutions at various levels (local, national, regional, and global). The journal is published quarterly and has been doing so since its establishment.

Capitol .xl.	The United States Capitol is the home of the U.cu.S Congress and the seat of the legislative branch of the federal government of the United States. It is located in Washington, D.C., on top of Capitol Hill at East Capitol Street and First St SE, adjacent to the Anacostia River. The Capitol was designed by William Thornton and construction began in 1793; it has since been enlarged and modified through numerous major additions and renovations, with each expansion reflecting the changing needs of Congress over time.

The conspirators argue that Caesar's ambition threatens the Republic, and they convince Brutus that assassinating him would be for Rome's greater good. This act marks a turning point in the play as it establishes the motives of the characters while also showcasing themes of power, loyalty, friendship, betrayal, and the complex nature of politics.

Capitol .lv.	The Capital, also known as capital.lv in some contexts, is the official seat of government and administrative center for a country or state. It typically hosts key institutions such as legislative bodies, judicial courts, and executive offices that are essential to the governance and functioning of the nation. E es o natural o accidental.	In English, the note represented by "E" is not categorized as a sharp (♯) or flat (♭), but rather simply as "E." The concept of sharps and flats applies to musical notation in languages like German ("D#" for D-sharp) or French ("Fb" for F-flat). However, the note E remains consistent across different languages, without any sharp or flat alterations.

Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter LXXIII (Capital Letter) - In the English alphanumeric system, Roman numerals are used to represent numbers using letters from the Latin alphabet. LXXIII is a representation of the number 73 in this system, where "L" stands for 50, "X" represents 10 and each successive "X" adds another 10, while "I" denotes one unit. Thus, when combined as LXXIII (50 + 10 + 10 + 1 + 1 + 1), it results in the number 73.

In English, the equivalent would be "few" when referring to a small number but more than just 'one' or 'two', although there isn’t an exact single word that covers all uses in both languages.

La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The Cristero War, also known as the Cristiada or "the Dress Rehearsal" in English, was a widespread conflict between Mexican Catholics and secularist, anti-Catholic, government forces that took place from 1926 to 1929. The name 'Cristeros' refers to the rebels who fought against the government, with "gran" meaning great or large, indicating a significant impact on Mexican society at the time. In Catalonian language, one might say: "La Guerra de Cristinos, també coneguda com la Cristiada o 'l'ensayo d'vestir', va ser un conflicte ample entre els catolics mexicans i les forces gubernamentals anti-catolicistes, que es disputaren des del 1ebelí a l'any 1926 al 1929. El nom de 'Cristinos' fa referència als rebels que es batian contra el govern, on "gran" significa gran o molt, indicant una millor impacte en la societat mexicana a la seva veu."
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The tip of the dial is lowered less than this guideline shows; and it's further away from the bag as indicated below so many times.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit. E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	C is a bag in which the urine of an animal (either from a beast or sheep) is stored, and its capacity is one pail.

E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja. E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	In the event of an unfortunate accident, place yourself supine with your legs raised and arms outstretched to one side, allowing someone else to carefully lay you on a suitable surface; gently rub some oil or ointment onto the affected area. Afterward, have the caregiver apply pressure at specific points for relief. Carefully remove the bandage, ensuring that blood is not excessively released all at once; then, after removing the dressing from the wound, reposition your limbs to a comfortable position and ensure proper healing.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	If the medicine induces sleep, take as much rest as possible; and if you sleep all night through, it will be even more beneficial for recovery.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat. E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	If one suffers from hemorrhoids or piles, the symptoms may include mild to severe pain and discomfort in the anal region. Hemorrhoids can be internal (inside the rectum) or external (around the anus), and they often involve swoln blood vessels that cause itching, burning sensations, or even bleeding during bowel movements. It's essential to consult a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment options tailored to your specific condition.

De las plaguas del ventre.	From the stings of the belly.

E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio. Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre. So let me know if you'd like to know as well, at this time I will tell you how to wash your hair using a soap bar in water by yourself or while having shampooed hair, and adding cypress, spices, and embrocations so that the balm becomes resolved within that wrapped bag.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	Some vinegars contain substances that make them effective for use in treating inflammeration, and are more beneficial than water alone in the resolution of inflammation.

Therefore, it is crucial to address this issue promptly, as your skin may absorb the harmful chemicals present in water that tastes excessively salty or has a malodorous smell due to pollution from various sources.

E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	The first curative measure is better when it is owned that it does not dry up, and cannot be occupied to dry out by necessity or need.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	This phrase in English translates to "Dal segno, repeat from the sign." It is an instruction commonly found in sheet music for orchestral and ensemble pieces. The term "dal" means "from," while "segnó" refers to the musical symbol indicating a place where the piece should be repeated.
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc. The extreme sport of bone keying, also known as skeleton lock picking, involves unlocking locks using specifically crafted tools that mimic the function of traditional lockpick sets but are designed to manipulate the pins within a lock cylinder with minimal damage. This skill is often associated with historical reenactment communities and enthusiasts who enjoy exploring old techniques in security bypass. However, it's important to note that engaging in activities such as bone keying without permission can be illegal or cause harm to valuable antiques. It's crucial to only practice this skill on locks you own or have explicit consent to work with for the purpose of preservation and education within a legal framework.

This disease is known as Bovine Spongiform Encephalopamia (BSE) in any land; it was formerly called mad cow disease. It occurs when infectious proteins, known as prions, are ingested by cattle and affect the nervous system, causing a range of symptoms such as loss of coordination, behavioral changes, and eventually leading to severe neurological damage. BSE is considered a type of transmissible spongiform encephalopathy (TSE), which also includes similar diseases in humans like Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD).

E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	E exorcised an evil spirit from a man who had been possessed by it, and thought he might have died because of that; so, after passing over thirty days without showing any signs of his conditions improving, I pressed upon the spirit and extracted it out, and he was cured, and no harm befell him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	There once was a man who caught a snake in his arms, and secured the skin on him, and kept it by fire for seven days, until he skinned it off at the tail'angs.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	A woman was seen holding a snake in her belly, and the pregnancy continued within her, without any change to her physical state or condition, and the woman experienced nothing amiss with regard to her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	He felt another pain in his chest and the wave of nausea swept through him; he didn't feel any real discomfort or resemble this before.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	The princess of the king who was being hunted in her nearby nest had already given birth and the entire brood (sagita) was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	You are called to the care of Luke, who has been involved in an accident, within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then you will not see the wave that is about to break, and then you will inquire which one tempts you so subtly; but do not feel it. However, you hear its echo behind your right ear, and therefore suspect that it is caused by the edge of the wave.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	The vine of the valley is situated on an elevated location that overlooks it, which appears attractive and digestible to me; consequently, my affection for this place increases.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	In English: I do not have an accident at the place of significance where my little boat has reached; and I continue to be enchanted by it for many days without any accidents; meanwhile, the land solidifies during this time, and after some days within which a day passes before I sense in my nose what he told me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	Therefore I will pause the medication treatment for acute corrosive poisoning after two days within which focus on rest, and now I have tried that and succeeded in slightly touching the tip of my finger, which sticks to the stick.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	In the article of the plague, if I perceive my foot to be affected by that acute medicine, then apply it immediately; otherwise wait for four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	In case of an exacebitious storm, it may possibly involve the laws in my intervention and remain therein, without hindering progress, these hours I have not ceased to become more subtle and ingenious on that matter with engineering means within which I began one day upon those matters concerning forceps-assisted descents performed, according to the form of such procedures at the end of the caputule, into which I extracted said storm.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Ealus metges decretó que el cartílago del nariz no sería restaurado y él lo reparó, y la piel se consolidó, pero sanecieron las lesiones por completo, y nunca tuvieron ningún efecto en nada.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre. E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	The learned authors say that a little about much makes less; and the water which is now present is greater than the water which was absent; and it results in new operations and new instruments regarding the descent of external causes related to the craft, which cause accidents.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	Thus, I believe that sentences are not arbitrarily formed by the members in which they are inserted, but according to two rules: either through an attraction of the location where they intersect or through the opposite side of the other party.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	The translation from the Romansh language (Sursilvan dialect) to English is as follows: "From that which is wrapped in a woolen cloth and then inserted into a body part, it emerges and becomes unwrapped." This sentence appears to describe some form of medical procedure or treatment involving wrapping an object in wool before placing it inside the body.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio. E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada. E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada. De fleubotomia de las venas.	The phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The puncture sites for phlebotomy that are most commonly used to draw blood are the following: In these verses from the Bible, specifically Psalm 23:4 which says "Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me." In the Book of Tobit, He tells Raphael to take from Adam's body the following veins which are connected to his ears - hair-like structures (auricles); certain herbs found in both temples; tears stored in two glands that are called lacrimal sacs; a vein prepared on the forehead; and a vein located at the end of the nose. Also, take from the neck guidelines (veins), as well as veins found underneath the upper lip, and veins found beneath the lower lip - these are called angelic veins. Lastly, gather two additional veins that extend downward below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	The veins that were just flushed in the arms are now clean. Quart de celles is a cephalic vein and it's called the "vein of the head" by locals; it's migratory in nature and comprised of both a branch from the basilica (basilar) and another from the cephalic. The people call this the "vein of the entire body", whereas the basilica vein is situated within the domestic latz and referred to as the "cephalic artery". Locals refer to its branches simply as "the abdominal veins", which are located over the belly button (umbilicus). The arm's vessels, pausing above the elbow, have a visible appearance and it is through these that venipuncture occurs. Lastly, salvatella is the vein running between the auricular (ear) muscle and its smaller counterpart.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	In Latin: Venae tres sunt in pedem equi: una ex ilia curvatura femoris ossis cruralis; altera saphena, locus ipsius sit post tibiam lentis silvestris; tertia sapiens, locus eius sit post tibiam lenticularis domesticae. Et in tibia sunt aliae venae quasdam ad similitudinem haece.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The blood of the veins that flows through the arteries is an ancient cure and migrates, nourishes, and heals old head wounds and sores.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta. E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident. Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	The two veins, which also supply the temple region near the site of phlebotomy, are the external jugular and internal jugular veins. These carry blood from the brain back to the heart.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	The quality of a bloodletting procedure should be as follows, which I recommend to you: causing little pain with the tool in use that clearly displays the two veins while evoking the feeling through noticeable action and your pulse is evident; and later on, your sign will attempt.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	A) Insert the needle above the vein, as per your instructed location, and advance the catheter slightly beneath the skin. Then elevate the vein towards you using your other hand; insert the cannula while doing so, just like you did with the other two veins. Finally, let the blood flow according to the amount needed for your procedure.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Take off the bandage of the wound, and pause your talk about the vein for one hour, then place pressure on that spot and rub it gently to strengthen the muscle contraction, and let that area be healed.

E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	Thus, the juice of fluebotomy from the vein at the front is applied to the fluebotomy on the cephalic side in order to treat old illnesses of the face and promote healing and foul-smelling ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	The quality of the flebotomy performed by you is as follows that I recommend to you; it is because the strong illness causes its vein to appear with a bandage inside, and then take the instrument which is called a lancet, whose form is described here:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Pause the point that is prominent on the tip of the needle over that vein and puncture it onto its surface or another cause in the manner you prefer; then release the piercing pressure of the malady, allowing the blood to flow according to the desired quantity. Capitol .xcvii.	The word "Capitol" originates from Latin and refers to a building in which a legislative assembly meets, such as the U.S. Capitol where Congress gathers. However, there is no Roman numeral representation for this term because Roman numerals are typically used to represent numbers, not words or names of buildings. The closest association you can make with "Capitol" and Roman numerals would be if it was a number itself (such as 100), which could then be represented in Roman numerals as 'C'.

Capitol primier.	First-class mail, also known as capital or priority mail in some countries, is a postal service for delivering standard letters and small packages quickly and relicuosly to recipients within the same country or internationally. E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Therefore, if you experience a bone fracture, dislocation, twisting, or crazing, it is adviswart that you seek medical attention at your earliest convenience through an open reduction (surgery) or closed reduction (manual manipulation), depending on the circumstances and unless contraindicated for any reason. E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	A proper content in veins should consist of herbs and vegetables, as well as lean meats from poultry and rabbits; while avoiding fatty foods and filling the stomach with any kind of substances that cause blood clotting, provided there is no history of hemorrhage or fear of excessive bleeding in any member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Now she returns to her original troop, with which she is accustomed to serving.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	So the broken bone begins to be restored, as soon as the malady has passed from consuming nutritious foods rich in protein and fat like bread made of wheat with water, cheese, eggs, fish, meat from cattle, butter, fresh peas, and similar things, and under this regimen a coagulation of fracture is formed more quickly and easily.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor. Capitol .v.	In the context of government, a "capital" refers to the city or town that serves as the seat of government for a country or state. This is where the main government offices are located, and it often hosts important political buildings such as the legislature (parliament or congress), executive residence (such as the presidential palace), supreme court, and sometimes even embassies from other countries. Examples include Washington D.C. for the United States, London for the United Kingdom, and Canberra for Australia. Capitals are usually selected based on strategic locations such as political centrality, historical significance, or geographical accessibility.

Capitol .xi.	The English translation for the Latin phrase "Capitolium" is "Capitol". In ancient Rome, the term referred to a temple dedicated to Jupiter Optimus Maximus on the Capitoline Hill - one of the Seven Hills of Rome. It was considered one of the most important and sacred temples in Roman religion and played significant roles throughout history as both a religious center and an emblem of the city's power and influence.

Capitol .xv.	The United States Capitol, located in Washington D.C., serves as the home of the U.S. Congress and is an iconic symbol of American democracy. Inaugurated in 1800 and completed in its current form after a fire in 1857, it has witnessed numerous historical events throughout its existence. The Capitol building stands atop Capitol Hill and houses the Senate and House of Representatives chambers where important legislation is debated and passed. Its neoclassical design reflects influences from ancient Rome and Greece, embodying ideals such as democracy, citizenship, and governance that have been central to American history.

E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas. E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	If you want to do this in the same manner as above at the place of the altar (let's assume it means an altar or sacred space), then you should stand on the ground, and your feet shall be together at a distance equal to one armspan between them; and your head will be in line with the last two stakes on either side, which are each a length of one palm apart. In every stake where it turns around, its motion is fixed in place on the ground so that none of them may move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	Let S be a hollow cylinder with radius r and height h, whose axis is at the origin, and let R(θ) = (r*cosθ, r*sinθ, z), where -h/2 <= z <= h/amoùt. Then the revolving surface E is described by the set of points {R(θ): 0 <= θ < 2π} in space.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	In the tip of its branch is a cross wherein the trunk is formed, the length of which equals one span and a quarter that is rolled around; in the other two branches it is similar to this.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	A firmly establish the connections that you have strained during times of malice and distress, and those bonds that you have strengthened in your past endeavors for which you shall bear responsibility, and the ties that you have formed throughout experiences with them from which you shall carry the weight.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	A near each door stands a minister who guards the door and makes sure it matches what has been said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	French: Voici la forme du tore :
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	The spinous process has returned to its original position and the location is identical again; in some cases, pauses are required to reinforce excision of an albumin fracture, and a stopop is placed; then the pause is applied using the stiffening element of a table with which length varies by three inches or more and width is equal to the quantity needed for the height of the vertebrae, and over the location of the spinous process.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	Upon careful observation and based on what has been mentioned, use the subtle effects of malnutrcuition to maintain good health.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	There is no immediate danger at the site after sanitation, but there should be continuous monitoring and administration of disinfecting medicines that may last for a long time, which we have recommended; already administered in that location with a layer of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	Some cases of acute appendicitis present with pain in the latter part of the second ribs, and it is related to that displacement; this bone is which already predisposes so that you don't need such a procedure for this treatment, because it greatly increases your risk of mortality.
